summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview summary of a woman (name redacted) conducted on August 26, 2019. She describes her background as a model, her recruitment in 2004 at age 19 for a massage job by a woman named 'Ghislaine', and a subsequent sexual assault by Jeffrey Epstein at his New York home. The document details the grooming, the assault, and the significant psychological impact on the victim.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Present as the attorney for the interviewee during the FBI interview at One Saint Andrews Plaza, New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the wealthy client who paid for massages. The interviewee details being sexually assaulted by him at his New York home after being recruited.

persons.name: Ghislaine
persons.context: A blonde woman with an Eastern European accent who approached the interviewee at a coffee shop, recruited her for Epstein, and facilitated the initial meeting. Described as grooming the victim.

persons.name: Paolo Zampolli
persons.context: Founder of ID Models, which the interviewee signed with at age 18. Described as 'sleazy', dating models, making her get a short haircut, and then letting her go.

connections.description: Ghislaine is described as recruiting young women for Epstein, referring to him as 'Jeffrey', and arranging appointments for massages at his home.
Ghislaine recruited the interviewee under false pretenses for a massage job with Epstein, which the interviewee later recognized as grooming.
Epstein sexually assaulted the interviewee during what was presented as a massage appointment at his New York home.
Zampolli was the founder of ID Models, which the interviewee signed with. He made her get a short haircut and then let her go.

events.title: Recruitment by Ghislaine
events.description: In the summer of 2004, the interviewee (age 19) was approached by Ghislaine at a Union Square coffee shop. Ghislaine recruited her for a massage job with a wealthy client, Jeffrey Epstein, promising cash payment.

events.title: Sexual Assault by Epstein
events.description: The interviewee went to Epstein's New York home for an appointment. Epstein, wearing only a towel, assaulted her after she was told he would not touch her and she would keep her clothes on.

events.title: Victim Leaves New York
events.description: Following the assault, the interviewee had a mental breakdown, was fired from her job, and called her parents to pick her up. She moved back home, feeling safer.

events.title: FBI Interview
events.description: The interviewee provided a detailed account of the 2004 assault and its aftermath to the FBI, AUSA, and a detective at One Saint Andrews Plaza, New York.

locations: One Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York (FBI interview location)
Fort Hood, Berlin, Munich (Interviewee's childhood locations due to father's military service)
Los Angeles, California (modeling with ELITE MODELS)
New York, New York (modeling, coffee shop job, Epstein's home)
Union Square, New York (coffee shop job)
keyFacts: The interviewee was recruited at age 19 in 2004 by a woman named Ghislaine, who described a wealthy client (Epstein) who liked 'young pretty girls' for massages.
During the massage appointment at Epstein's New York home, he sexually assaulted her after demanding she remove her clothes, contrary to prior assurances.
Ghislaine was described as actively grooming the victim, taking her and friends to a club, boasting about Epstein's connections (friends with a president), and her own recruitment earnings.
The assault caused severe psychological trauma, leading to a mental breakdown, job loss, and the victim fleeing New York to return to her parents.
The document is a formal FBI record (FD-302) of the victim's testimony, dated March 23, 2020, regarding an interview conducted on August 26, 2019.
